---
title: Changing background colour with range input
description: Use the range input to change the colour of the background
image:  data:image/png;base64,
date: 2023-08-01
rss: true
style: '
  :root {
    --hue: 255;
    --hsl: hsl(var(--hue), 100%, 70%);
  }

  .changebgcolour {
    background-color: var(--hsl);
    width: 100%;
    height: 100vh;
    max-height: 1000px;
    min-height: 600px;
    border-radius: 0.75rem;
    display: flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
  }

  .inputwrap {
    background: white;
    border: 1px solid lightgrey;
    box-shadow: 0 5px 30px 0 hsl(var(--hue), 100%, 40%);
    border-radius: 5px;
    padding: 20px;
    margin: 0;
    display: flex;
    flex-direction: column;
    justify-content: flex-start;
  }

  label {
    font-weight: 700;
    margin-bottom: 10px;
    color: black;
  }

  input {
    accent-color: var(--hsl);
  }
'
scripts: '
<script>
  document.addEventListener("DOMContentLoaded", () => {
    document.body.innerHTML += `<style id="hslVariable"></style>`;
    const range = document.getElementById("hslRange");
    const style = document.getElementById("hslVariable");
    let hue = range.value;
    style.innerHTML = `:root{--hue: ${hue};`;
    range.addEventListener("input", (event) => {
      hue = range.value;
      style.innerHTML = `:root{--hue: ${hue};`;
    })
  });
</script>'
---

{% block css %}

{% endblock %}

{% block main %}
<ul class="unstyled inline">
  <li>üèÜ CodePen featured this on their homepage</li>
</ul>
<div class="changebgcolour">
  <div class="inputwrap">
    <label for="hslRange">Change background colour</label>
    <input type="range" id="hslRange" min="0" max="360" step="1" />
  </div>
</div>
{% endblock %}
